body_html:
The code that manages writing out the events file is tf.train.SummaryWriter (Python), which is defined here:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/training/summary_io.py

It uses the tensorflow::EventsWriter (C++) class to actually write each file:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/util/events_writer.cc

The underlying file format is indeed recordio. I don't believe there are any special tools for writing Tensorboard events files; you're just supposed to use the tf.train.SummaryWriter Python class.

@danmane probably has an opinion on using Tensorboard with non-Python clients.

body:
The code that manages writing out the events file is tf.train.SummaryWriter (Python), which is defined here:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/training/summary_io.py

It uses the tensorflow::EventsWriter (C++) class to actually write each file:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/util/events_writer.cc

The underlying file format is indeed recordio.  I don't believe there are any special tools for writing Tensorboard events files; you're just supposed to use the tf.train.SummaryWriter Python class.

@danmane probably has an opinion on using Tensorboard with non-Python clients.
